methods.javadoc:
For subclasses to do specific application initialization after all general application
 initialization occurs.
methods.name: initializeApplication
methods.comment:
For subclasses to do specific application initialization after all general application
 initialization occurs.

methods.javadoc:
Returns whether or not the application is headless.
@return true if the application is headless; otherwise, false.
methods.name: isHeadless
methods.comment: Returns whether or not the application is headless.

return.comment: true if the application is headless; otherwise, false.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the currently set task monitor.
@return The currently set task monitor, which is by default a dummy monitor.
methods.name: getTaskMonitor
methods.comment: Returns the currently set task monitor.

return.comment: The currently set task monitor, which is by default a dummy monitor.

methods.name: isInitializeLogging
methods.comment: Returns whether or not logging is to be initialized.

return.comment:
True if logging is to be initialized; otherwise, false.  This is true by default, 
 but may be set to false by the user.

methods.name: getApplicationLogFile

return.comment:
The user-defined log file. This is null by default and will only return a
 non-null value if it has been set by the user.

methods.name: setTaskMonitor
methods.comment:
Sets a task monitor that will be called back with messages that report the status of the
 initialization process.

methods.name: getScriptLogFile
methods.comment: Returns the user-defined script log file.

return.comment:
Returns the user-defined script log file.  This is null by default and will 
 only return a non-null value if it has been set by the user.
